[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Media Library System (MLS) defines authentication, customer registration, borrowing management, and overdue tracking requirements for library operations.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: MLS supports customer registration, work categorization, borrowing management, overdue tracking, and consultation-only access.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: MLS integrates with identity databases, cataloging systems, and external media databases.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: MLS provides a structured UI for customer registration, borrowing history, and media catalog access.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: MLS supports barcode scanners and computing devices for loan processing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: MLS uses a React.js frontend, Node.js backend, PostgreSQL storage, and REST APIs for integration.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: MLS employs OAuth 2.0 authentication and TLS 1.3 encryption for secure transactions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: MLS optimizes data storage for high-volume borrowing records and real-time transactions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: MLS ensures 24/7 availability with scheduled maintenance.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: MLS supports multi-branch libraries with configurable access policies.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: MLS integrates with cloud-based or on-premise deployments, supporting Docker and AWS.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: MLS enables customer registration, borrowing transactions, overdue management, and consultation-only access.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: MLS is designed for librarians, registered customers, and library administrators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: MLS requires internet access for real-time updates and external database synchronization.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: MLS relies on identity verification, borrowing history, and cataloging systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Borrowing Sheet: A record of customer loans and due dates.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with identity databases for customer verification.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall connect with external cataloging services for media updates.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow librarians to register customers, assign membership types, and update records (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall manage loans, enforce borrowing limits, apply overdue penalties, and send notifications (REQ-DB-001, REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall block overdue borrowers, send alerts, and lift restrictions upon return (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall differentiate borrowable and consultation-only works, enforcing restrictions where applicable (REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive UI for searching, reserving, and borrowing works.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process borrowing transactions without significant delay.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store customer details, loan records, and borrowing history.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall ensure unique customer and work identifiers.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with data protection regulations for customer privacy.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log transactions, enforce access controls, and encrypt sensitive data.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests for customer registration, borrowing restrictions, overdue handling, and consultation-only enforcement.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, and security policies.
[SEC] 5. References: Library management best practices and data privacy regulations.
